name: Adrian Cochrane
text:
@roytang Reminding me of Sergey Yashanka...

I only heard this urban legend from a Magnus Archives episode building upon it, but the story goes that in 1983 during the first home computer revolution Sergey Yashanka was lethally sick & terrified of dieing. So he attempted to upload his mind to his computer dying gruesumely doing so. Police found floppy disks filled with impossible code, which got reencoded, shared, & faked by niche communities ever since.

1/2
